question: Mammalian lungs have an enormous number of minute alveoli (air sacs). This provides:
option1: more surface area for diffusion of gases
option2: more space for increasing the volume of inspired air
option3: more nerve supply to keep the lungs working
option4: more spongy texture for keeping lung in proper shape
answer: more surface area for diffusion of gases
explanation: In mammals and the more complex life forms, the two lungs are located near the backbone on either side of the heart.Mammalian lungs have an enormous number of minute alveoli (air sacs).
